text:
Growing up, I was an introverted, agreeable and emotionally stable child. I kept my thoughts to myself and rarely started arguments with others. I was shy and often had trouble paying attention, but I was also kind, considerate and helpful. I was a good, hard worker and I liked to cooperate and go along with others. I was rarely careless and I did things carefully and completely.

My parents noticed my calm and steady demeanor early on and they were always supportive of my personality. I was never pushed to be too outgoing or too competitive. As long as I was productive, happy and healthy, I was encouraged to be myself.

I was never interested in athletics, but I did enjoy creative activities like art and music. I was often found in my room drawing or playing music. I was creative and inventive and I had a good, active imagination. I was curious about lots of different things and I liked to think and play with ideas. I was also a good reader and enjoyed books, though I often had trouble staying focused for long periods of time.

I was never the life of the party or the loudest person in the room, but I did enjoy spending time with others. I was comfortable in small groups and I liked to listen and observe. I was always kind and considerate to almost everyone I met. I had a good, strong personality, but I was never too pushy or aggressive. I was content to stay in the background, but I was still able to make connections and form relationships.

I was rarely nervous and I stayed calm in difficult situations. I was relaxed and I handled stress well. I was also never too moody and I was rarely upset. I was a steady and reliable person who was rarely cold and distant with others.

My childhood was happy and peaceful. I was never a major source of stress or worry for my parents. I was well-behaved and polite and I usually followed the rules without being asked. I was a good, hard worker and I was usually organized and had good plans that I stuck to. I was rarely lazy and I had a lot of energy when I was doing the things I loved.

Overall, I was a content and well-adjusted child who was happy to be who I was. I was introverted, agreeable and emotionally stable, and I had my own unique interests and passions. I was kind, considerate and helpful and I liked to spend time with others. I was rarely careless and I was a good, hard worker. I was relaxed and I handled stress well. I was creative and inventive and I liked to think and play with ideas. I was rarely moody or upset and I stayed calm in difficult situations. I was never too pushy or aggressive and I was content to stay in the background. I was the kind of person who was always reliable and rarely caused trouble.
prompt:

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.
